channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Seeing Greene: How to Use Home Equity to Retire, Buy Rentals, or House Hack
item.description: Should you use a HELOC to buy investment property? Would we use home equity to retire? When is it time to sell a performing property and exchange it for a […]

item.title: Bumble users can now report profiles that use AI-generated photos
item.description: Bumble’s new reporting option arrives at a time when, unfortunately, AI-generated photos on dating apps are common © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Jackson, Mississippi, Wants Curfew Centers to Cut Crime. Here’s What Other Cities Learned.
item.description: After a teen’s murder, city officials hope a curfew and youth centers will get kids off the street. Young people are skeptical.

item.title: 80-Hour Workweeks to Lean FIRE in 8 Years through Real Estate
item.description: Reaching financial independence and becoming a millionaire before the age of thirty?! While this path requires several years of ruthless saving, smart investing, and unwavering discipline, there’s no reason why […]

item.title: Talky social app Airchat gets a major overhaul, making it more like an asynchronous Clubhouse
item.description: The concept of Airchat is fun, especially if you're someone who loves to send voice memos instead of typing out long paragraphs on your phone keyboard. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Love Beyond Bars: Miguel and Silvia
item.description: While Miguel Solorio did 25 years for a crime he didn’t commit, his wife, Silvia, was right by his side. Here’s their California love story in pictures.

item.title: A Revised Affordable Housing Law In Florida Takes Opportunities Away From Developers
item.description: A revision to Florida's Live Local Act reduces incentives for developers and increases building restrictions.

item.title: The fall of EV startup Fisker: A comprehensive timeline
item.description: Here is a timeline of the events that led fledgling automaker Fisker to file for bankruptcy. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Crime Rates and the 2024 Election: What You Need to Know
item.description: As crime data again becomes a flashpoint in the presidential campaign, experts push for better national statistics.

item.title: Airbnb Bans Only Make Tourism More Expensive. Just Ask New York.
item.description: New data from New York City shows that short-term rental bans haven't moved the needle on housing at all.

item.title: Openvibe combines Mastodon, Bluesky and Nostr into one social app
item.description: Ahead of these potential competitors comes Openvibe, a simple aggregator for the open social web. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Death Row Prisoner’s Parting Interview
item.description: Days before his scheduled execution in Texas, Ramiro Gonzales speaks on faith, legacy — and apologizing to the family of his victim, Bridget Townsend.

item.title: 5 Ways to Find Off-Market Real Estate Deals Like a Pro
item.description: Off-market deals can be a huge source of great deals, if you can find them.

item.title: Should venture capitalists be held accountable when startups screw up?
item.description: Welcome to TechCrunch Fintech! Last week was a holiday in the United States, so news was a bit lighter than normal. But there was still fintech-related items to report, including the ongoing drama around Synapse and partner Evolve Bank, Revolut’s record year and more. To get a roundup of TechCrunch’s biggest and most important fintech […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The New Battle Over an Old Institution: Forced Prison Labor
item.description: Inside the latest legal and legislative efforts to close state constitutional loopholes that allow slavery as punishment for a crime.
